result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Renee Ann Motley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Renee Ann Motley appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Renee Ann Motley.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense bail motion hearing.  Arguments heard.  For reason stated on the record Court denies any no contact order modification.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing Vol. I  ( 12 pages) commencing 08-11-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.

Defendant Renee Ann Motley appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Renee Ann Motley.  Prosecuting attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel still needs offer from the state.  Defense counsel requests bail motion on no contact order.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Renee Ann Motley appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court in person for Renee Ann Motley.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Continued preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer T. Soltes. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Renee Ann Motley in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Renee Ann Motley.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense's Bail Motion on no contact order.  Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any modification of no contact order. Case remains calendared for continued Preliminary Hearing.

Case recalled at 10:21.  Defendant's motion to withdraw defense counsel is denied by the court.  Case remains calendared for Continued preliminary hearing on 9/20/2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Renee Ann Motley in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Renee Ann Motley appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Soltes. Case adjourned due to lack of time to complete hearing. Defense requests Bail Hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for continuation for cross examination. Case is adjourned for continued Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Renee Ann Motley
Current: 2977 N 70th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 07-27-2022)
Prior: 2977 West Lisbon Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WK and AM.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/29/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Renee Ann Motley in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
